name: Slow Cooker Spanish Beef Stew
author: Moefunk04
summary: I have never heard a complaint of my beef stew, it's a great new take on an old favorite! I prefer to serve stew over white rice, it all depends on your taste. You can season the beef with a packet of Sazon instead of salt and pepper, for even more Spanish style.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
½ cup pitted and halved green olives
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat
Cook beef in hot skillet until completely browned, about 5 minutes; season with salt and pepper
Transfer beef to a slow cooker, retaining some of the beef drippings in the skillet
Return skillet to heat and heat the retained drippings
Saute onion and garlic in hot drippings until softened, about 5 minutes; add to beef in slow cooker
Stir potatoes, diced tomatoes, sofrito, and olives into the beef mixture
Cook on Low until beef and potatoes are fork-tender, 4 to 5 hours
